attributes.action: Bring the qualifying criteria for the Disabled person's Bus Pass into line with the New (2006) criteria for the Disabled Persons Railcard.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Last Autumn the qualifying criteria for the Disabled Person's Railcard were extended to include all those on Long Term Incapacity Benefit and those on any rate of Disability Living Allowance for over a year.

I believe this is far more inclusive and logical than the seven qualifying categories used currently for determining eligibility for concessionary bus travel.

These, I believe discriminate unfairly against those with a mental health condition (as opposed to a learning disability) and people with invisible conditions causing (for example) pain and fatigue.

These types of long term condition can also result in low income and inability to afford to run a car or (particularly in rural areas) afford bus fares which may be considerable.

In my own area (Cumbria) the return fare to the nearest large town/ administrative centre has just risen from £8.00 to £9.00!
